item.description: make call on phx60 - u should just do it on thursday start a post mortem on week 1 for azure remember to call out what processes/systems they should build to make this easier next time why is a full cluster maintenance so high touch compared to CW or GCP GCP goes in the bg CW i trust highlight the key wins and thanks we appreciate ur work - infra is a thankless job where you expect near-perfect reliability/performance and allow little affordance for downtime or blips this maintenance was a healthy reminder that this is unavoidable this is necessary at the same time this maintenance revealed a lot of weaknesses in our system - or lack thereof feedback to them feedback to ourselves analogy: its as if the mta suddenly had transformers about to explode and needed to replace all of them in two weeks we should get to a point where it is not impossible to our current systems to enable these maintenances i want to be like the japanese shinkansen where u allow downtime to get that time we need trust better systems more resources/better allocation of such buyin from ur other infra stakeholders operational flywheels let us trust u that u will pursue better systems what documents/artifacts should i produce?

We need a slack channel to coordinate this maintenance with minimal product disruption ( @anniez¬†/¬†@simont) inference-stack is not fast enough to detect when an engine is bad quickly it can take an hour for the ILB to find that an engine is unhealthy Unplanned node-failures can create cascading retries and thundering herds that can lead to sev-0 product outages The problem with c262 and c271 is that they house many chatgpt A/B tests In A/B tests, users are sharded and hard-fixed to engine-groups, if we remove virtual models in an engine-group then that shard of users will experience higher latency We want A/B tests controlled for latency Strong preference against “gradual maintenance” Mahmoud / Meng prefer reduced capacity for predictable and available product experience by quarantining an entire cluster for the duration of the upgrade (one cluster at a time) Otherwise, the strategy discussed: figure out which racks we will do a maintenance on taint the nodes Option A [Preferred] Have Simon rebalance (rebalances may take a while and might not complete in time for the maintenance) Option B remove active engines from routing table by deleting virtual model wait for at least 10 minutes then actually delete the engine.

item.title: 6-30 reflection
item.description: my parents came to the apartment after 2 weeks of not getting to sit down for a dinner at home – i think of how rare it is every night, we sat together for our nightly dinner ritual – how beautiful even now we can do this – overwhelmed by gratitude for my parents – my dad tells me his vision swims when he looks at the screen – he has to increase the size ten-fold – he tells me he wants to retire, that he cant keep up any more – that he’s the only foreigner, he’s the oldest one, he knows his time is out – my vision swims as he tells me how proud he is, i watch his cracked hands, peeling, peel open a clementine for me without second thought, he admits he’s getting old – he used to just say getting older, why is he saying old now?
im starting to get it, now. at some point we reach a carrying capacity at how far our ambitions can grow.

item.title: flow momentum
item.description: cognitive friction: the jarring disconnect between expected momentum and forced pauses during creative flow interruption cost: the mental and emotional price paid when flow is broken limbic friction: the tension between wanting to maintain flow and being forced to stop protecting creative flow means: recognize that pausing creates real friction, not just inconvenience maintain inertial direction by continuing forward even with imperfect output separate creation from evaluation honor momentum as a valuable resource that shouldn’t be wasted preserve your attention and focus as [[content/attention is all u need|attention is all u need]] cut unnecessary fat later rather than filtering during generation prioritize fundamentals first, refinement later inertial direction in creative flow: maintain momentum by pushing forward without filtering easier to cut fat later than to pause and restart applies to writing, ideation, and editing protect good ideas by letting them flow uninterrupted separate creation from evaluation focus on fundamentals first, everything else is additional unnecessary friction kills momentum better to have excess to cut than gaps to fill the core/fundamental idea deserves protection from dilution momentum creates clarity - sometimes the only way to see what matters is to generate everything and then sculpt away what doesn’t

item.title: infra enabling ml workloads on fintech startups
item.description: background in batch processing for fintech batch is a vm management and job sheduling platform finance bg: nonexistent infrastructure (schedulers) to lift and shift bursty workloads, large-scale tend to move away from ISV’s and run algorithms by themselves workloads: ETL, ADF, montecarlo determinism / reproducability low latency (for fraud, trading, underwriting) real-time inference still immature compliance visibility as regulators require full transparency on why a decision was made for this customer conservative buyers - need bulletproof governance, SLAs, compliance guarantees pain points: strategic customer cases Bank of America Milliman pricing models Infra Setup a) Compute layer On prem HPC clusters high security Cloud compute elastic burst capacity / pecialized chips hybrid b) Data layer Data Lakes (S3, azure data lake) Data warehouses (Snowflake) Streaming data c) Orchestration layer Training orchestration: Kubeflow, AzureML Inference orchestration NVIDIA Triton - low-atency, highly reliable serving infra

item.title: is the way an llm learns language similar to us
item.description: How LLMs and Humans Learn Language: A Comparison Attention Mechanisms Humans have biological attention mechanisms that help us focus on relevant information LLMs use “attention” as a mathematical mechanism to weigh relationships between words While both systems have “attention,” they work fundamentally differently: Human attention is tied to consciousness and awareness LLM attention is a mathematical operation that computes relevance scores Learning Process Humans Learn language gradually through interaction and experience Start with basic sounds (phonemes) and build up to words and grammar Require relatively few examples to learn new concepts Learn through social interaction and feedback Develop understanding through physical experiences and multiple senses Can learn from context and implicit meaning LLMs Learn through massive parallel processing of text data Process language purely as statistical patterns Require millions of examples to learn patterns Learn through supervised training on explicit data No physical or sensory grounding of concepts Struggle with implicit meaning and common sense Key Differences Sample Efficiency: Humans learn from far fewer examples Multimodal Learning: Humans integrate multiple senses and experiences Grounding: Humans connect language to physical reality and experiences Consciousness: Humans have subjective experience and awareness Error Correction: Humans learn actively from mistakes and feedback Similarities Pattern Recognition: Both systems identify and learn patterns in language Context Sensitivity: Both use context to understand meaning Hierarchical Processing: Both process language at multiple levels (words, phrases, sentences) Research Directions [1906.

item.title: notes on power
item.description: the race for ai has become inextricability interwined with geopolitics how do we outperform china how do we disrupt their supply chain how are the tarriffs going to affect ai theres a disconnect between the tannnins of a big ai system and the data centers that need to power it Two key forces drive the rapid development of AI: Economic incentives for companies The first companies to build AGI could gain trillions in value This creates pressure to move quickly, even at the expense of safety Strategic incentives for countries Countries fear falling behind in a critical technology Military and economic advantages create a “first-mover” mentality Power concentration: The ability to automate human labour concentrates unprecedented economic and political power in the hands of those who control these systems, risking a slide toward authoritarian regimes.

item.title: ok im
item.description: ok im writing this down bc when i try to record a VM i sound funny HAHAHA yeah ur v right that the high costs of these ai companies come from the compute power they need – inference jobs require low latency (which is how long it takes from input->output, aka generate whatever result u want from the ai model), and the training part needs super strong gpus to process all that data, esp when its a deep learning model and baseten prob is a huge cost savings for a customer who has a scrappy data engineering team missing the resources / knowledge to spare to figure out autoscaling on their own and isnt big enough to get the “white glove treatment” from a cloud service to move onto the cloud (i realize that the support that i mentioned before only rlly applies to like huge enterprise customers, who get the “white glove” service) i think im still confused on their aws comparison bc baseten is on aws marketplace and they seem to be partners w them & nvidia so i think if u use their cloud it’s just aws?

item.title: pacific surfliner notes
item.description: 7/19/25 writing [[content/to dare to care|to dare to care]] [[content/free will vs duty|free will vs duty]] [[content/americana|americana]] observations la is cooler/cloudier than i expect - the cloud consumes the sky passing by dump yards of trucks and trash cans and debris and cardboard boxes spilling onto the floor makes way for bulbous bushes and dry grass expanse of brown hills distant powerlines i adore the way the upcoming scene slides into my purview people watching - people running within the grass in the distance, people getting off the train and walking up the stairs, ants climbing a mountain, multi layers or movement trees aer so interesting here - verdant tendrils that spiral outward like hands human life in third person pov mini ponds flattrees driving along a long river introspection i want to improve my “mece” thinking - aka, how do you create a framework / data model / ontology that encompasses the component of a problem, while being legible and understandable?

Sci-fi story ideas: [[ai translation and human connection]] “Emotional Rollback” Idea that our states are preserved within github-like instances, and we can “rollback” to a state preceeding a checkpoint Someone wants to forget an uncomfortable breakup and rolls back what if u tried to roll back ur last iteration pre breakup - heart has its own memory separate from brain * We‚Äôve only done small rollbacks before - to do so many at once is irresponsible and crazy * Friend sarah has done it before, and shes so much happier it seems * Scene 1: doing the rollback * 2: memory glitches * 3: full breakdown * 4: seeing him again, resolution and acceptance * related to power semiconductor x dune x sand [[her in 2025]]

item.title: systems design interviews
item.description: Which database to use? Relational database Non relational database if app requires super low latency data is unstructured only need to serialize and deserialize data need to store a massive ammount Vertical scaling vs horizontal scaling Vertical - scale up - process of adding more power (CPU, RAM, etc) to servers Has a hard limit - imposible to add unlimited CPU and memory to a single server Lacks failover and redundancy Horizontal - scale out - scale by adding more servers into your pool of resources Load balancer evenly distributes incoming traffic among web servers defined in a load balanced set Database replication

item.title: to dare to care
item.description: a piece on earnestness nabeel: the will to care 13. Nabeel S. Qureshi - The Will to Care - Jackson Dahl how to foster care: original seeing and intimacy physical engagement follow genuine excitemet Instagram ocean vuong seen how students are more and more self-conscious of trying - surveillance culture around social media they would see “i want to be a good writer / poet” but it’s a bit cringe i dont’t want to be perceived as trying and attempting to achieve my dreams fear of judgement perform cynicism - it can be misread as intelligence you are disaffected, you are too cool, you’ve seen it all you are so deeply hungry for sincere, earnest work do it privatey bc they do it privately they’re actualy trying to do something among peers sincerity is whwat we deeply hunger for teachers have a role to set the stone and steward sincerity, judgement-free zone to allow folks to be sincere and earnest and it wont be cringe and liberate them to their true selves once i accept that i am cringe, i was free to become my true self personal anecdote - storing away my poems and writing in google docs that i revealed to key friends, and humiliated when our friendship fell through

item.description: What area of scientific progress would you like to write about?
